page.title: 12Housing
page.content: Though there are a number of very old properties in Hundon the majority of the homes have been built during the twentieth century. During the 1930's a number of properties were built by the local councils. These houses are still in use and many have been bought from the Council by the residents. In the 1970's there was a sudden "rash" of building developments in the village. This was largely,in my opinion, the result of the GLC OVERSPILL policy. The balace of "natives" and "newcomers" was upset and the atmosphere of the village changed together with the attitudes. Many of the new residents finding it difficult to accept the lack of services and amenities. The pattern of life is now more settled (1985) with the discontented having moved out of the village again.
